DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Bone Metastatic Involvement Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of evaluation for the evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to bone located in another part of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to evidence of the spread of cancer from a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells to bone located in another part of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:(MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised to provide naming consistency for related elements

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
